title: Mount St. Helens: A Two Year Anniversary Analysis of the Ongoing Eruption

und.value:
WHEN:

Friday, September 29, 2006, at 10:00 a.m. PDT  

WHERE:

Cascades Volcano Observatory, 1300 SE Cardinal Court, B10, S100 Vancouver, WA, 98683

DIRECTIONS:

Online directions at http://vulcan.wr.usgs.gov/CVO_Info/cvo_location_map_text.html  

WHAT:

It has been two years since Mount St. Helens began its current dome-building eruption.  Join CVO scientists for a retrospective and analysis of the ongoing eruption.

WHO:

U.S. Geological Survey

Daily advisory updates, earthquake data and other information for Mount St. Helens and the other Cascades volcanoes can be found on the Internet at http://vulcan.wr.usgs.gov/Volcanoes/Cascades/CurrentActivity/current_updates.html and http://www.pnsn.org/HELENS/welcome.html.

Note to Editors: For those outside the Vancouver, Wash. and Portland, Ore. area, a number of lines will be available through our FreeConferenceCall.com conference bridge. The dial in number for the conference is (605) 990-0100. The access code is 1009678 followed by #.
